meanings.sent1: In the forest, the conspecifics of the deer grazed peacefully together.
meanings.sent2: Birds of the same species are conspecifics and often flock together.
meanings.sent3: The conspecifics of the squirrel threw a surprise party in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The conspecifics of the lion formed a powerful alliance in the savanna.
meanings.sent5: The conspecifics of the fish swam in perfect harmony in the coral reef.

meanings.definition: An individual belonging to the same species as another.
meanings.sent1: The conspecifics of the monkey groomed each other to strengthen their bond.
meanings.sent2: A conspecifics of the zebra joined the herd as they migrated across the plains.
meanings.sent3: The conspecifics of the cat took turns napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Being conspecifics, the wolves understood each other's howls perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The conspecifics of the penguin huddled together for warmth in the icy Antarctic.
